intro: Galium pumilum var. laxissimum, commonly known as the slender bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It typically features slender, prostrate stems that form dense mats, often growing in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic in shape, and covered in fine, soft hairs. Galium pumilum var. laxissimum is characterized by its delicate appearance and its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils.
